ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Professor Pellegrino is an excellent instructor. You will learn Italian very well if you take her class.
I developed a much better vocabulary and speaking skills in Italian
Deeper understanding of Italian grammar. I now feel like I could actually survive if I was dropped in Italy.
My understanding of tenses was improved. This course placed an emphasis on grammar and I believe I was able to strengthen tenses that I learned in L1, as well.
Good course for practicing and learning grammar. Unfortunately not much emphasis on spoken Italian.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course will help you learn Italian. Professor Pellegrino's grading is very strict though. You will lose points for very small mistakes. Just know that you will have to pay a lot more attention to detail for her class than in L1.
Everything was great. The class was really engaged and we all learned a lot, all of the activities were really useful.

The class meets four times a week which means that you can get a lot of practice with Italian if you choose to participate. The teachers are also amazing and Deborah is incredible and very understanding. A weakness of the course is that we don't really studying Italian culture, until maybe the last few days of class. I wish there was more of a focus on culture.

Pros: The course is well organized, the instructors are good, the in class exercises are fun. Cons: Way too much material is crammed into this course and some of the reading assignments are incomprehensible. 

I think this course could be improved by pushing congiuntivo and periodo ipotetico to L3. The remaining time could be used to practice and reinforce material. I felt like a lot of the stuff I learned was forgotten immediately because I didn't have enough time with it before moving on to the next topic.

Strengths: 
Great teaching and emphasis on grammar. Attending class everyday allows you to understand spoken Italian better too.

Weaknesses: 
Not a lot of room to make mistakes when writing essays. Not a lot of emphasis on speaking and conversation.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. But if you really want an A, prepare to grind. Even then, you may not get an A.
Yes, if they want to learn a higher level of Italian its great for that.
Yes! This class is more rigorous but you also come out of it feeling like you speak Italian.
I would recommend this class because it truly improved my Italian skills but it's important to remember you get out what you put in, especially with language classes.
Yes. Overall it is a good course.
Yes; the Italian department is great and holds events to help facilitate learning.
